register.reg_condition: when ARMv8.1-VHE is implemented or ARMv8.2-Debug is implemented

purpose_text.para: When HCR_EL2.E2H is set to 1, identifies the current Process Identifier.
The value of the whole of this register is called the Context ID and is used by:

listitem.content: The debug logic, for Linked and Unlinked Context ID matching.
The trace logic, to identify the current process.

purpose_text.para: The significance of this register is for debug and trace use only.

note.para: When HCR_EL2.E2H is 0, CONTEXTIDR_EL2 replaces CONTEXTIDR_EL1 where CONTEXTIDR_EL1 would usually be used.

configuration_text.para: If EL2 is not implemented, this register is RES0 from EL3.
This register has no effect if EL2 is not enabled in the current Security state.

field_description.para: Process Identifier. This field must be programmed with a unique value that identifies the current process.

note.para: In AArch32 state, when TTBCR.EAE is set to 0, CONTEXTIDR.ASID holds the ASID.
In AArch64 state, CONTEXTIDR_EL2 is independent of the ASID, and for the EL2&0 translation regime either TTBR0_EL2 or TTBR1_EL2 holds the ASID.

access_permission_text.para: When HCR_EL2.E2H is 1, without explicit synchronization, access from EL2 using the mnemonic CONTEXTIDR_EL2 or CONTEXTIDR_EL1 are not guaranteed to be ordered with respect to accesses using the other mnemonic.
